reviews.title: Inconsistent diameter 1.58mm to 2.94mm on spool
reviews.review_text: This cord is ok - hard and stiff but ok. The problem is that it is wildly inconsistent in the diameter. The picture I took is from 1 piece that I cut to 18". One end is 1.98mm and the other end is 2.94mm! Further into the spool it gets down to 1.58mm. I was in a bind when I bought this from Walmart. My supplier sent me the wrong size so I was scrambling to find something locally. I would not recommend buying this brand of cord if you have fixed sized ends that you are putting it into.

reviews.title: Unusable.
reviews.review_text: This is terrible. I bought it to make jewelry. Once I opened it, I only touched a piece and black dye came off on my fingers. I decided I could not make a necklace with it, because it would stain anything it was worn with. I tried to wash the dye out of a piece and see if it would be OK once dry. The amount of black dye that washed out of it just with water was unbelievable. Plus, it's very coarse and would feel uncomfortable against the skin. This is unusable.
the cord had a shiny fake look to it because of all the wax on it. cuts horrible. feels fake. you can tell a mile away.

reviews.title: Defective

reviews.title: Unwanted Involuntary Actions
reviews.review_text: I have only had this laptop for a few months, and it has consistently experienced serious performance issues. While working, the device frequently performs involuntary actions on its own, disrupting productivity. The only way to temporarily resolve the problem is by completely shutting the laptop down, which is neither practical nor acceptable for a new device. Unfortunately, the only solution offered so far has been to continue shutting it down when issues occur, which does not address the underlying problem.

Ordered the item, the shipping was a hot mess. When it finally said it was delivered, it was delivered to Delaware I live in Texas. I contacted Walmart and the customer representative was very helpful and reached out to the seller for them to contact me. They emailed stating the package was delivered on this date. I replied it was not delivered and I would like a refund. Waited a few more days, no response. I contacted Walmart again, again they reached out to the seller to contact me. The second email from buyer basically said it was delivered check with neighbors or family members to check receipt. I replied back that I have cameras, my neighbors have cameras and nothing was delivered. I also advised them that delivery services take pictures of the package when it's delivered. I got the email it was delivered but no picture. Walmart was very helpful in every aspect of this. I only gave a low rating so they would take notice of their 3rd party seller on marketplace. I finally did get a refund from Walmart.

reviews.title: Mixed Feeling About the G9
reviews.review_text: Having previously owned an EliteDesk G4 Tower I was expecting the Elite G9 to be a natural progression. However, I have mixed views. While the larger amount of RAM, the better processor, and faster USB ports were an immediate benefit, I was disappointed that HP has removed the rear line-input and didn't fit an optical drive. I was aware of the missing input, and I've had to utilise the front socket. However, I was misled about the optical drive. I had asked the sales support if an optical drive was fitted, and I understood it was. It isn't. It may well be possible to fit one later, but that's not the point. Also, I've mixed feelings about HP Wolf Security. Having read a lot of reviews I'm in two minds whether to replace with my trusted alternative. However, having said all that, I'm looking forward to years of reliable service. If the G9 does as well as the G4 I'll be well pleased.

Overall, a consistent slow load time and constant lagging even with only one web browser open. Would NOT recommend and will be returning!

I haven't gone on any websites that are not school related so I know there isn't a bug from me on here.

reviews.title: Sent older model computer than listed

I've called multiple times and left messages to the company but they refused to respond to the matter. I wouldn't of even cared, but windows 10 wont be supported on this computer in the next few months. Just for the fact that's they were so deceiving about all of it, makes me so frustrated for other customers of theirs that won't notice. If they fixed the mistake or at least acknowledged it happened, that would be one thing. But straight up taking advantage of people is unacceptable.

reviews.title: Poor Keyboard Design
reviews.review_text: The laptop's overall design is poor because the keyboard is not based on the standard design, as evident in the backspace being further right. Also, the shift key on the right side is much smaller than the standard keyboard. The caps lock key doesn't have a light on it, so there is no way for me to know that I've accidentally hit it until I notice all letters are in capitols. In addition to the keyboard design flaws, the mouse pad is rather large, which makes it awkward for me to use because I usually rest my wrist on the bottom of laptop as I type, which makes my hand heel hit the mouse pad. If you are a poor typist (one of people who use only two fingers to type) and do not bend your wrist or rest your wrist as you type, this laptop might work well for you.

reviews.title: Bought a different computer elsewhere.

reviews.title: Deceptive buisness practice or honest mistake?
reviews.review_text: Agree with others who reviewed this product. User manual is a waste unless you read chinese. No setup instructions included. Two days after receiving laptop began sending me messages for updates needed and out of date. (verion of windows has reached end of service actual message). However upon trying to update from windows version 22H2 to 23H2 it will not allow me because the end of service date was Oct 8 2024. Contacted microsoft about this issue and how to update and thier response was i am unable too. According to them the processer is not big enough and out of date so untill this issue resolved i am stuck. I informed them that this was a new laptop and purchased within days of contacting them. Thier response was i had been misinformed because in fact after they tried to use their team view to investigate the problem i was told the laptop was actually 4 years old according to their checkout of the laptop. My question to you is how would you like to proceed in making good on this purchase? I purchased this laptop for my buisness and have aleady lost two weeks dealing with these issues so sending this one back for repairs is unacceptable in my opinion due to the fact it was advertised as being new. I propose that you in fact send me a verifiable new unit with an RGA number and address to send this unit back to you postage paid. I will be anticipating your response and contacting me as soon as possible

reviews.title: Untrustworthy Company %26 Product
reviews.review_text: Please do not ever buy products from them. I bought a laptop from them in February of 2024. In October, I started having issues with the cooling fan making terrible sounds. I didn't get to reaching out to them until earlier this month because of things going on in life, but I still did it within the one year after sales period. They told me it would take several months for them to “repair” it and even then, it is “unknown”. I told them I cannot be months without a laptop, and they told me there's essentially nothing they can do. They then turned around and offered a replacement. I asked them if I would have to cover shipping costs to send the faulty product back, and explained that I cannot afford to send a laptop to New York (do y'all know how much that would cost? I can't do it, I'm struggling to get by right now). They got rude with me, saying that they won't cover the costs because I'm past my one year after sales period, even though I'm not? Then proceeded to tell me I agreed to a partial refund when I was never offered a refund nor did I agree to one, because I wasn't offered one? Even if I had been, I'm not agreeing to a partial refund for something I paid $310 for and haven't even had a year only for it be messing up already.

reviews.title: Fraudulent Marketplace Supplier Scam
reviews.review_text: I am a bit surprised that Walmart would allow a fraudulent Marketplace Supplier to run a scam on your portal. The subject order was placed with Walmart. Payment for subject order was made to Walmart. Subject order was returned utilizing the UPS Return Authorization Shipping Label paid for and provided by your Marketplace Supplier. Proof of Delivery of the return of subject order was provided to both Walmart and your Marketplace Supplier. All my attempts to follow-up with your Marketplace Supplier regarding a refund have been either ignored or summarily dismissed. Subsequent contacts with the Walmart Customer Service Department seemed to be spiraling into the black hole of your circular files. All requested responses to E-Mails from Walmart Customer Service, Customer Care and Payments sent to me go to their unmonitored address. Seems like there should be a better way to communicate!! I'm beginning to think Walmart could care less if this issue is ever resolved. Your assistance in resolving this lingering issue and providing the refund credit due would be much appreciated.

reviews.title: Walmart and Seller act clueless if problem occurs
reviews.review_text: AirPods quit charging within the first year which would have normally been covered under manufacturer warranty, but this seller fraudulently entered a sale date of 7 months prior to my purchase! So Apple won't cover repair bc seller won't update DOS to the true date. Walmart and myself have tried contacting this seller multiple times and all they do is send back and copy and pasted response telling me how to print from my account. I don't need to print, I need Walmart to be honest and update the sale date to what it truly is. Unfortunately, no one can seem to figure this out. I have called customer service at least 15 times and spent about four hours on the phone. I have called my local Walmart stores in a desperate attempt for help, but they have no offerings, and the third-party seller has been contacted. Still no solution. So here I am with AirPods that won't charge, a manufactures warranty that won't be honored, and an extended warranty plan through Allstate, which won't be honored, because they say that I was supposed to be covered by Apple. Everyone in the situation is just putting your hands up in the air like “it wasn't me, it wasn't me” but I am not looking to blame anyone, I am desperately searching for a solution.

reviews.title: Fake Discount, Real Disappointment
reviews.review_text: I thought I scored a deal getting these IKT headphones for $21, supposedly marked down from $126. Turns out the price is always $21 — the $126 is just a fake crossed-out number to make it look like a bargain. On top of that, the quality is awful. The plastic feels cheap, the sound is tinny, and the noise cancellation? Completely useless. I can still hear my lawn mower and even my neighbor's while cutting grass. Don't fall for the fake discount — these aren't even worth the $21.

First off I've come to realize they don't even blow air which you would think, it is a fan how is that even possible! But, they literally blow no air. Secondly they've been attached to my shelves undisturbed. and they literally have just broken. The clips have literally just broke. They are never moved, touched or anything. I just finally realized that my plants weren't moving and then I felt them and there was no air coming out of them. And then they have just fallen off my shelves. The clips just snap and fall off. These have been the absolute worst fans and an absolute waste of my hard earned money.

reviews.title: Like a steak plate without the steak
reviews.review_text: Unfortunately, I didn’t get to use the product. It didn’t work at all, and the fan came without the clip. Kinda like the time I ordered a steak plate at the steakhouse and they gave me a plate without the steak. Lol. Anyway, I won’t purchase again, and wouldn’t recommend to anyone. Maybe you’ll get one that works and comes with the clip or maybe not. But, good luck if you do buy. :) ♡

reviews.title: Misleading ad. Poor description
reviews.review_text: Ordered online, which I hate doing. I like looking at what I'm buying. When received and opened, I was immediately disappointed. The fan guard was a little over 6" and the fan blade was a fraction over 5". Plugged it in and set it to high and could hardly feel the air flow. The ad said 15CM. Nowhere, did the literature describe what 15CM meant. Assuming the meaning meant 15 cubic meters per minute, wrong. Air flow was more like 15 cubic meters per hour. Returned fan for refund.

Almost no surface in my room would even hold it securely(i can get it on there but the weight would pull it down or a slight knock would). It need to be thin enough but also deep enough for the clip to actually work. Also the cable was too short for my needs. Anywhere near a socket was not able to reliably grip and anywhere it could grip would need an extension cord.

I will have to go buy some rechargeable batteries because I already threw away the packaging thinking it was rechargeable.

It was basically a waste of money and wasn't even what we originally wanted but what we wanted wasn't in stock apparently.

reviews.title: A used, broken cable, battery gobbler.
reviews.review_text: I damaged one of my three Honeywell Turbo On The Go Portable Folding Personal fans that this fan is a dupe of. The Honeywell wasn't available, and it being hurricane season, decided to give this one a try. What a mistake. Firstly, when I received the fan it was clear that it had been used and the previous owner had been kind enough to stick the cables severed usb port to a sticky label, so it wouldn't get lost. I decided to try it with batteries which only lasted a few hours, compared to my Honeywells that run for multiple days. Unlike the Honeywell it has multiple speeds. The profile is bigger than the Honeywell, but only has a third of the power. It died after 2 weeks of occasional use and 16 batteries. I'm usually happy with Mainstay products, but this one needs to be pulled from shelves.

reviews.title: Some versions make a whistling noise when running
reviews.review_text: I bought 2 of these and found that there are two versions with slight differences. One has a round tightening knob for the angle of tilt and the base is designed to sit angled downward a little in front. This kind makes a whistling noise when running which is annoying. The other has a "T" shaped angle adjustment knob and the bottom of the base is made to sit flat. This type makes a normal humming noise running. I tried returning the whistling one hoping to get another of the type that is better and just hums when running. Unfortunately, I got another whistling type as a replacement.

I figured it was a bad crimp or something and I was planning on cutting and making several patch cables from this anyways, but even after cutting the ends off and crimping new connectors properly, it still only gives 100 MB. reviews.title: Defective, replacement defective too
reviews.review_text: Western Digital My Book 12TB external drive would not display in Windows 10 file manager. Ran Western Digital diagnostics and got "SMART status failure". Return unit and purchased another which came with box previously opened. This one did at least have a driver loaded, but still would not display and got "SMART status failure" when running WD diagnostics. I own another WD 12TB drive that has worked fine for years.

reviews.title: Run from this!
reviews.review_text: Run from this. Regrettably, I bought this one and another 16tb drive because I have the WD Pro and they worked fine. Needed an external usb and bought this brand for the 16tb and 12tb. It has been less than a year and both began making the dreaded click of death!!!! Neither have been replaced yet even though still under warranty. I will never buy WD drives again including the WD Pro (-seriously how would you feel)?

When I got home I noticed the box had already been opened(the seals were broken). I still hooked it to my computer but the hard drive was bad, it was pretty obvious because of the loud ticking noise coming from the disc drive inside enclosure. I had to return to store with hard drive, apparently exchanges are not a thing any more and had to go threw this huge ordeal.

reviews.title: Arrived on time as ordered.
reviews.review_text: Arrived not working. States "fatal hardware error", after troubleshooting the hard drive is bad. All connections, the cables etc are good and the computer based on trying multiple ports.

reviews.title: selling 3 year old computer equipment as new
reviews.review_text: When I registered the product with Western Digital, they told me this device was made in Mar 1 2022. My purchase was Mar 15, 2025. They wont honor any warranty until Walmart can prove I was sold a new device and not a used/refurb devise. What a crooked way to do business by selling 3 year old Computer Devices as new. Ever heard of Moores Law? Did you know the generation cycle is normally about 6 months? That would make this drive a Great Great Grandfather. You have shattered my belief and trust I've had in quality of items I get from Walmart

reviews.title: Incompatible with WD Smartware!!!!!
reviews.review_text: I was not informed by sales literature or WD website that this drive (part of the new series of drives) is not compatible with WD Smartware Backup software until I looked very deep into their website.. The replacement software (My Backup) will not install on any of my 5 computer systems. It sucks.

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.review_text: This USB hard drive is by far the worst one I've ever earned. Every time you try to open a file or you try to save a file it "thinks" for a very long time. It takes so much time to open or close file or just navigating through the folders.

reviews.title: Short life. Won't buy WD again.
reviews.review_text: Hard drive was great while it worked. Failed a little over a year in. I have multiple hard drives that are pushing 10 years of age. It's a rare occurence for me to have one fail, much less so soon. I won't be purchasing this brand again.

would have gotten a better review but the cord that connect the hdd to whatever you are using it with was messed up when i got it and they wouldnt replace it somi.had to buy another one. was only 11 bucks but still....not the point.
Apps would not get installed on windows 10 PC. Upon connecting it to PC, it would not start and PC froze. I returned it the next day. It seems that the hard drive was damaged.

reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Time
reviews.review_text: When connected to any USB port on front or back of Windows desktop computer, device was recognized by computer, but not by explorer, and therefore it could not be initialized. WIndows reported that most current driver was installed, and that device was working properly. This definitely was not true. I wasted an entire day troubleshooting this item.

reviews.title: 14tb My Book
reviews.review_text: Ok so far?? Time will tell?? Very sad that Western Digital thinks it is unnecessary for a power/active blue LED Light like in the older harddrive??? Don't know it is functioning unless you access from "My PC"?? My old 640Gb had worked great for 18 years. Usb cord is very short?? 3 foot?? How cheap! At least a 6 foot would be acceptable?? Cant even place My Book on desktop?? Won't reach pc tower under desk!! Why??

reviews.title: poor quality, bad experience, returned
reviews.review_text: the software (.exe file) shipped on drive did not load. The downloaded version had issues. Once I got software up and run the drive made a "clunking" noise every 4 to 5 secs and this was at idle not read or write. Called CS they said this was not normal and to return.

reviews.title: Great hardware, poor software
reviews.review_text: As usual with WD drives, the hardware is solid. I just hate the archaic lock software on PC. You have no easy way to toggle different computers to auto unlock without password. It's been YEARS and still doesn't work right. You have to remove the password and can only autounlock 1 computer, usually. It should be a simple toggle after typing in the password, and then possible ask for the password again or some second measure per computer. The software needs to be updated. I NEVER buy a WD drive without hardware encryption, but the software behind it lacks, always. WD, HIRE some good people to refresh this and make more options and make it user friendly.

reviews.title: Do not buy. Failed within a week.
reviews.review_text: The drive began failing within a week. Not recognized by any system unless forced to mount, endlessly clicking the hours to its demise.

reviews.title: Works, but missing the activity light
reviews.review_text: It works, but I really miss the activity light on my other external drives that Western Digital used to put on the My Book drives. My other complaint is that the utilities that came with it are not backward compatable with my old My Book drives and made them inoperable.

reviews.title: Didn't Last more than 3 months.
reviews.review_text: This was for my business, and it worked GREAT until it didn't. that time period was shocking considering it's a WD HDD. it lasted until August 20th, 2021. 3 months is NOT acceptable for the cost I paid. I'm just relieved I (as always) bought the extra warranty Walmart offers.

reviews.title: Connectivity
reviews.review_text: Does not connect to home network. I received a link from WD saying the new drives replace my older mybook and they gave an incentive to purchase. This on was one of the recommended drives. Once I received, I realized there was no way to connect it to my home network. So it is a paperweight.

reviews.title: Works But Loud
reviews.review_text: My second unit after the first no longer worked with my Apple operating system. Used the first now and then with Time Machine and it worked fine. Haven't used the second yet. Only down side is the noise the second makes sitting on my desk which "microphones" the sound. Had to bungee cord it to a slab of cork and then set the slab on an air cushion to dampen the WD unit's loud vibes.

reviews.title: Damaged
reviews.review_text: When I first hooked this up it had a really bad vibration and was super loud when reading/writing files. Also had like a bad rhythmic vibration that you can hear and feel just by touching my desk it was on. Few days later it stopped showing up in my files. I had to unplug and plug in the power every now and then for it to show up. So now I am re-transferring my data to the old drive and replacing this with another brand.

reviews.title: Cheap unit but stays warm which may fail soon
reviews.review_text: Typical WD My book that was nicely priced. What was weird was the funky 2 combined connector... Not sure if this is the new standard USB 3 connector but this was the first time that I see this.... I use this as a backup device and it still stay warm even when it is not backing up. The server that I am backing is configured to turn off the usb interface when not in use. I am not sure if My Book power management is working. May need to switch to a NAS backup if the unit fails prematurely from overheating. Another setup issue that I did not like - I needed to format the unit before using. Would have preferred to have the unit pre-formatted.

reviews.title: Damaged
reviews.review_text: Not only is this product not from Walmart it could come potentially damaged or with the wrong size internal HD . Mine stated it was 6 or 8 TB and it never held the data. reviews.title: Good value but LOUD
reviews.review_text: It is incredibly loud and vibrates my desk making me think my phone is ringing. Other reviews have stated the same but it still concerns me that it sounds like it's dying right out of the box.

reviews.title: Problems with the drive I received (12 TB My Book)
reviews.review_text: Unfortunately the drive I received here is a bum. From day one, it made loud grinding noises. My other drives do not make these noises. When I checked the drive, it didn't show errors so I checked the cords with alternatives I knew to be working well. The noise was not consistent so I attempted to load files. The files wouldn't show correctly as if they weren't loading onto the drive. When I closed the folder and reopened, they were there. This is also not normal behavior. I also noticed intermittent behaviors were the drive would load much slower than the rest (including another 12 tb with matching files). Sometimes taking 15-20 minutes (I'd give up on it loading and go do something else only to come back and it's loaded). It has caused disk utility to crash and I haven't had that happen before. DU only crashes or loads very slowly when this drive is connected. Sometimes the drive doesn't connect at all. I reached out for support but will likely have to exchange under warranty. I feel there is something not right and I have numerous WD EHD's, this one is not behaving normally. I have a concern of being forced into a refurbished option but my drive is only 2.5 months old and has had this problem since day one. I wish I'd gone with my gut for the exchange before the first 30 days. I am also concerned I will now have additional shipping costs despite that this drive was sent to me like this.

reviews.title: FAKE DRIVES - Do Not Purchase!!!
reviews.review_text: BEWARE!!!! There is someone pulling the larger drives from these enclosures and replacing them with smaller or dead completely dead drives. Looked in mine because it was DOA and found a Hitachi 500GB dead drive in place of what should have been a WD 8TB drive.

reviews.title: Can't use!
reviews.review_text: Ordered to have on hand for future use after finishing and feeling better from cancer treatments and surgies. Opened today and it has the incorrect USB cord. The cord and adapter packaging look like they had been part of a return though box look new and unopened. Because it's outside of the return deadline (my fault) I now have an expensive paper weight.

reviews.title: Terrible.
reviews.review_text: Very disappointed went from a cheap $30 2tb that would reserve space for a 50gb game within a minute meanwhile this $90 4tb drive took nearly half an hour to accomplish the same thing. Huge waste of money wouldn't recommend for anything beyond pictures or small documents.

reviews.title: Very Poor Drive, failed
reviews.review_text: Documentation was very poor, it just contained a load of legal garbage, no instructions on how to set up the drive or transfer files. I found thru Google to use Acronis True Image WD Edition which was a free download. This did not work correctly and formatted the drive incorrectly so I had to reformat the drive thru Windows. I found a free program named Macrium Reflect which worked well to transfer my files. I then started having problems with the drive so I ran the drive tests in the western Digital software and it failed so I now knew the drive was bad. During this time I contacted Western Digital several times and they were not much help and would not give me a refund. I returned the drive to Walmart for a refund and ordered a Toshiba.

reviews.title: Not very happy
reviews.review_text: The hard drive is an Xmas gift, so I won't know how the recipient likes it till then. I'm not happy with FedEx, though. The box was left in plain sight in the middle of the front edge of my porch with no attempt to hide it. The driver did not ring the doorbell. It was not packaged well and rattled around inside the shipping box. One corner of the original box was somewhat crunched, so I took photos and opened the box to see if the hard drive looked damaged. It appears OK. The shipping box did not appear to be damaged, so I assumed the original box was damaged when it was put in the shipping box.

This drive is also extremely noisy, and sounds like it is grinding, so it will be for backup only, and not ever hold any critical information. I only bought this drive because it was inexpensive, but I should have known better, so that's on me. On another note, this thing is not compatible with Roku, which only decreases its usefulness that much more. Also runs considerably warmer than my other drives from another vendor...

reviews.title: Beware of WD Products! had issues with 3 different
reviews.review_text: What is the deal with WD products, currently I am having issues with 3 different of their products at once??!! My WDBFJK004OHBK My WD My Book hard drive is not working correctly, I was in the middle of downloading some files and shut my computer down to run errands and when I came back to finish the files my My Book was no longer showing up in my file explorer, it does show up under the section where it says eject item, it shows up in the drives manager but not the other manager. The hard drive is running, and light shows from the inside.( I ran the WD digital Data Life guard Diagnostics Tool and it shows the my book but says not available)As I said it was working perfectly and my errands took less than 30 minutes when it stopped showing in the file explorer anymore. The more I look into wd hard drives the more I find that thier products have a lot of issues that I did not know about when I looked into the research originally. I tried everything that was suggested. I plugged the hardrive directly into the wall, I shut down the computer a couple of times, I went in and unistalled the my book drive under all the areas you could do that and reinstalled nothing worked!!! this is ridulous how can their products have so many issues this one does not make sense. it was working and than it wasnt and I can not get to my files that I was back up which is the whole point of these products how is wd sitll in business seriously!? Issue 2 I plugged in my passport 2tb external hard drive that was working perfectly and has thousands of vids and other files on it into my WD live Media player to watch something off it and it played for a second (3 issues) but the purple screen that often happens with the WD media showed up again the files played fine but when I was done unplugging the hdmi cable it would not show the files on the screen anymore and now when I plug the passport in my computer to check it it will not show up on my File explorer or the drive file at all now!! This is Crap WD all of this has happened in just the past 3 days in the middle of another Covid shutdown, again how is this company still in business I now have several thousand files, and movies and things that I can now now find or retrieve or whatever!!!?? and these were my backups I only have some of what was on my My Book hardrive that is back uped on another hardrive but some of the best stuff was on this passport that suddenly stopped working or something??!Q!

So basically all my files are on an external hard drive that I can't open to delete the files so I can return it. Don't buy this. There's nothing convenient or efficient about it.

reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money.
reviews.review_text: You have to find work around a to do anything important. You can't download a digital cement directly to Microsoft/Onedrive or Google Drive. You'll have to download it to the hard drive, and if you try to then upload it to Onedrive or Google, there might be problems. E.g. if you fill out a pdf then try to save it or move it to Onedrive or Google Drive—-it will be blank and you'll have to fill it out all over again. It tries to force you to use WPS, but it's limited; you'll have to pay to do simple things like create two signatures to sign documents. Also, you can't disable edge. You can download Chrome or FireFox but the functionality defaults to Edge (so, you'll have to change a lot of default settings. But it will still run and slow things down.). Save yourself the headache and get a Chromebook or MacBook. Or an actual Microsoft or Dell laptop. They gave me a hard time returning it; make sure you keep the box.

reviews.title: Bought three, two of the screens have shattered.

That isn't a big deal. The real issue that we've had is with the screens breaking. We put screen protectors on them because they looked like they might scratch. Despite that when one girl dropped hers on a laminate floor and the screen shattered. Another bumped the side of a chair with hers and it also shattered. A drop of less that three feet breaking it surprised me, and I think that they should be able to survive accidentally running into a chair. They don't seem capable surviving of real life. It is a real disappointment, because they were really nice looking devices that otherwise worked well.

reviews.title: Does its job, but lacking.
reviews.review_text: Pros: -Durable headstrap. You can twist this thing any which way. -Lightweight. Doesn't press down head. Cons: - Lacks adjustment. It uses a suspension band instead of sliding ear cups, and the band only has two possible positions. Plus earcups are stationary and do not rotate. -Sound quality. Unbalanced and very slightly muffled. Other features tend to fall to preference wuch as wired vs wireless or mesh vs leatherette ear cups. So overall, functions as a wireless headset, but I much prefer the wired G432 for its better sound quality and adjustablity.

reviews.title: Issues with the flip down to unmute mic function
reviews.review_text: I would've rated this 5 stars but I have a few concerns/issues regarding this headset and I'm hoping the manufacturer/merchant sees this review and offers help. My first concern is that there were no written instructions or any kind of paperwork/manual in the box; it just contained the headset with the headband, USB receiver and the charging cord, no user documentation as it states on the box. My second concern is that when I am using the headset for work (windows 11 PC) it works great for the most part but my mic is muted even though it is flipped down. Now this is an intermittent issue but a critical issue as I am an inbound call center rep and the issue has occurred at the beginning of receiving a call. I use it with the avaya software as well as Microsoft teams, my mic gets muted when flipped down regardless of the software I'm using at the time. The only “fix” I have found is to flip the mic back up, wait a second and then flip it back down and it'll then unmute. Other than these 2 concerns, the headset is super comfortable - I wear glasses and rarely feel discomfort, it has great audio quality and noise cancellation for both the mic and earpieces. I really like this headset, I can see myself using it for a long time; I just need to find a way to fix the mic muting issue!

I have a habit of pushing one side of the headset off so I have an ear exposed, this headset is very very bulky and for the first few minutes it is comfortable but after that it starts to kind of hurt. If you wear the headsets normally they might end up working fine for you but if you like to have one ear exposed they definitely are too bulky for that. I ended up returning mine and getting a less bulkier headset for a few dollars more.

reviews.title: Not worth it it.
reviews.review_text: I read good reviews and bought this portable charger and have had nothing but trouble. I ordered three, but only two were delivered. Issues: 1- These batteries are not sent with instructions. 2- The on-off switch is inconsistent and does not always work. 3- The battery does not hold charge for more than a few days. 4- It's not clear that every port is bidirectional, as I expected that each port USB, USB-C can both charge a phone and be used to charge the battery pack. These issues were probably known by the maker. Do not buy this.

reviews.title: Bogus. Deceptive. False claims. 1/10.
reviews.review_text: Bogus. Not even close to 20, 000mah light and flimsy Way too thin to have a 20, 000mah cell. after extraditing the cell from its case, three charge/ discharge cycles show 8500-9300mah. The Charging board cuts out at 10-12 watts on electronic load. No "fast charge". no "Power Delivery". Also there is no thermistor on the pack, don't see pads for one either. Would not recommend. Will be returning the one I didn't rip apart to confirm these statements.

Not to mention when charging the battery or charging with the battery, it gets unnervingly warm whereas the other 2 I own from different brands don't get warm at all.. For the price it's cheap enough to where I'm not worried about a return or a refund but I wouldn't recommend it, just spend a little bit more and get a battery that is much better quality. I thought I was getting a huge deal buying this item "on sale" but I really just ended up paying more than it's worth.

reviews.title: Not worth the discount
reviews.review_text: This monitor appears nice on the outside, as it is asthetically pleasing, however, once you get on the inside, nothing but disappointment lurks. This is one of those times where the old saying "you get what you pay for" comes into play. There is one, and only one, button on this whole screen and it is a toggle like a joystick that you would find on a game controller. Using this toggle is clunky and awkward, especially with your arm around the screen. Toggling through available selections and selecting something to change is a nightmare all in it's own. This wouldn't be such a big deal if I was only using one input but I often switch between the two and the functionality just ins't there. It's stupid, to say the least. My favorite part is that sometimes when switching between inputs, nothing happens, and you have to unplug the cable you're not trying to use. Lucikly my desk is set up in a way that I can get to the back of it easily, but I shouldn't have to. Aside from input control, the on screen text leaves something to be disired - the font looks...pixelated? I don't know how to explain it other than to say it is NOT clear. If it wasn't for the size of the screen, I would have trouble reading. I have not used this monitor for gaming, so I can't speak to that, but I have used it for streaming which is just o.k. The blacks aren't very deep and the colors are so so. I am using this as a second monitor to a Dell laptop and the Dell is crystal clear for comparison. Overall, this just wasn't a good purchase, and you can order the same monitor from Temu, if that tells you anything.

reviews.title: Beware if trying to mount it!

reviews.title: SCAM! They sent a refurbished monitor!
reviews.review_text: Bait and Switch! I purchased what was advertised as a new monitor from Wal Mart. What I received was a refurbished monitor from "East Coast Entities". It even has a sticker that says that it is refurbished; it came without any instructions or warranty information; the cord was wrapped up with a rubber band- none of this was in plastic as all new hardware comes in. This is clearly a used/returned/repaired product. I emailed the seller. Their reply: "Hi, thank you for your message. This item is 100% brand new and unused in the package. We wanted to let you know that only the standard 30-day warranty is applicable for purchases made through Walmart". (Acer's website states that their products have a one year warranty so this seller is simply stating Walmart's return policy). This is a BAIT AND SWITCH SCAM! I will be returning this to Walmart today.

One USB-C cable hooks up your PM1 Series display to a laptop, sharing your display and transferring data while also supplying power. reviews.title: Not as advertised; specs are wrong!
reviews.review_text: 1. The phone comes with 2GB, not 4GB. 2. The rear camera is only 2MP, there is no 32MP rear camera, there is no LED flash, and there is no front-facing camera. 3. It runs KaiOS 3.1, not Android 13. 4. It does not have a fingerprint reader. 5. The battery is only 1450mAh, not 4000mAh. It's still a decent phone for the price and it has nice big buttons and a bright screen. It also has a mobile Wi-Fi hotspot feature (you need to have the service enabled on your plan). I wish it took as good of pictures as the original Cingular Flex which has an LED flash. I'm not going to return it but i wish they would fix the listing because this is technically false advertising.

So I cannot return it back to factory settings. My info is still on the phone. I know now that my seven years of bad luck begins with this company(Motorola). Money down the toilet. Also I've had an issue w an ironic case of while a missed call was leaving me a voicemail, I just so happened received another call that I wasn't even notified of & it didn't even show up in my missed call log . Luckily they left a message & it was recorded there & also in my visual voicemail as it was an important call as it was a from Dr office of whom my Dr referred me to to make an appointment to a cardiologist, so that was a terrible glitch for me personally so why I took a way another star.
